RequestJson.summary:
The json() method of the interface
reads the request body and returns it as a promise that resolves with the result of parsing the body text as .

remarks.para: Note that despite the method being named json(), the result is not JSON but is instead the result of taking JSON as input and parsing it to produce a JavaScript object.

RequestJson.returns:
A that resolves to a JavaScript object. This object could be
anything that can be represented by JSON — an object, an array, a string, a number…
